posts.post_content: I honestly don't know why this guy is getting so much crap from everyone. posts.post_content: nocturnus was a over powered card and costs some where around $20 - $30 to get if you were not lucky enough to find one in a pack. At least with this guy he is allot cheaper price wise, unconditionally buffs vampires, and has an ability to steal creatures AND make them vampires?!?!? [Mind Control](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mind Control) takes 5 mana to do that and if its destroyed you lose control of the creature, and it doesn't turn them into vampires. For black, creatures usually have to be dead in order to take control of them. I personally love to take my opponents cards while playing and smack them in the face with there own spell or card. Its allot more fun then going "Derp... OP aresomennersssss! I pewned Yerp Sorrys Buttt with mies net deck. Cuzz I so guud I can copys other peps decks..." Personally I wish they made a lord like this for the merfolk. I loved the **tap 5 untapped (*creature type*) you control do something awesome** ability back in onslaught. I only wish it didn't only belong ... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

posts.post_content: I'm pretty sure everyone griping about the art here is taking it the wrong way... I don't think Wizards is pandering to the Twilight crowd, I think they're taking a shot at them. Yeah, he's a gay emo looking vampire, but so is Edward Cullen, and for some reason, millions of girls are captivated by him too. The art, the name, and the ability are satirical. And in all honesty, that's a pretty cool ability. Maybe not useful for the 5 turn death race of standard, but as a casual player, I love nifty things like this.
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
I run 4. If you have 5 vampires out (should be fairly easy) and your opponent has no removal for ONE TURN, it's usually game. If you have two or three captivators out, not only are you stealing their creature, you're pumping them up significantly. Also, you can use his ability the turn he comes out as long as you have 5 other vamps.  
  
I used to hate the art as well, but when I started beating people with this guy, he captivated even me.

posts.post_content:
I love this card... I honestly don't think I could care less about peoples opinions regarding art quality and tournament playability. For a casual vampire deck... and as an easy turn 3 drop, I'd be very happy with the outcome. I get to boost my existing and future vampires, and on the off chance I get 5 on the board, then the game just got a whole lot more interesting.
  
   
Just take it as it is; a fun, characterful card.

Posted By: BiOhyBr (8/30/2010 9:36:40 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I am actually gonna stray from the pack here and say that I like this art, and I'm not a Twilight fan, or a girl. It's just well drawn, and captures the flavor. What else is art supposed to be?  
  
As for the card....you guys that are complaining about having 5 vamps out aren't doing something right. He has never, EVER hit the table for me in Standard, and not taken somebody's creatures, usually right then (and yes, he can do it right then. Read the rulings.). In fact, I actually took somebody's Captivating Vampire once. That was funny. And game.  
  
I actually took out 2 Nocturni so I could bump my count to 3. Fixed my mana curve a lot (I also made room for some Duress at the same time), gave me much more stability (I lost too many games topdecking lands with VN), and put me in a great position for Scars ( the other 2 Nocturni are my only rotating cards).
posts.html:
I am actually gonna stray from the pack here and say that I like this art, and I'm not a Twilight fan, or a girl. It's just well drawn, and captures the flavor. What else is art supposed to be?

As for the card....you guys that are complaining about having 5 vamps out aren't doing something right. He has never, EVER hit the table for me in Standard, and not taken somebody's creatures, usually right then (and yes, he can do it right then. Read the rulings.). In fact, I actually took somebody's Captivating Vampire once. That was funny. And game.

posts.post_content:
Wow...what great art...oh wait, I'm NOT a fourteen-year-old girl! FAIL!  
  
\*\*\*  
  
I said on [Barony Vampire](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Barony Vampire)'s comments that these two cards need to swap art. Her looks and her stance make her look sort of coy and flirty, but in a cold, vampiric way (how you'd imagine a "Captivating Vampire").   
  
THIS dude, on the other hand, fits Barony Vampire's flavor text remarkably well. His whole mien exudes the "creepy, bad-touch predator" thing that BV's text seems to imply. I'd definitely not let this guy within 1000 feet of an elementary school.
posts.html:
Wow...what great art...oh wait, I'm NOT a fourteen-year-old girl! FAIL!

***

I said on Barony Vampire's comments that these two cards need to swap art. Her looks and her stance make her look sort of coy and flirty, but in a cold, vampiric way (how you'd imagine a "Captivating Vampire").

THIS dude, on the other hand, fits Barony Vampire's flavor text remarkably well. His whole mien exudes the "creepy, bad-touch predator" thing that BV's text seems to imply. I'd definitely not let this guy within 1000 feet of an elementary school.

posts.post_content: honestly, you all are focused to much on what the card looks like and not what it can do. I run four in my vampire deck. all you have to do is run a bunch of weenies like pulse tracker and gruul draz vampire and the lacerator, and then turn three play the captivating it makes them stronger and anything they play that makes a big threat take it, i beat my friends white weenie deck all the time with this. because he will play baneslayer and i'll be like ok cool now i get a 5/5 angel vampire hybrid badass turn ur opponents strongest creatures against them. its a lot faster and more useful the the roil elemental. im just saying.
